definition: on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)

sentences.english: Small property owners paying back loans.
sentences.chinese: 小业主还贷款难上加难。

sentences.english: Comparing to songs, pure music is much more difficult to search.
sentences.chinese: 不过和找歌相比，找一首音乐更是难上加难。

sentences.english: It is extremely difficult for foreign brands to enter into Japan main market.
sentences.chinese: 外国品牌，进入日本主流市场是难上加难的。

sentences.english: “Change is hard,” he said, “and big change is harder.
sentences.chinese: “变革并非易事，”他说“大的改变更是难上加难”。

sentences.english: And without a strong recovery, it will be even harder to repair the budget.
sentences.chinese: 而没有强有力的恢复，要去平衡预算更加难上加难。

sentences.english: That reduces even further the tickets available to Joe Public.
sentences.chinese: 这样，普通大众能得到演出票的机会更是难上加难。

sentences.english: This will make it exceedingly difficult to reverse the trend in the future.
sentences.chinese: 这无疑使得在遥远的未来彻底改变这种状况难上加难。

sentences.english: But such posts increasingly look like gems among dross.
sentences.chinese: 但是要找这样的贴子越来越像沙里淘金，难上加难。

sentences.english: In today’s turbulent economy, it is even more difficult.
sentences.chinese: 在当今动荡的经济，它更是难上加难。

definition: lit. even harder than reaching the sky (idiom)/fig. extremely difficult/far from an easy task
lit. as rare as phoenix feathers and unicorn horns (idiom)/fig. few and far between
to want to/to feel like/to fancy/to care for sb/desirous of
to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
can be discovered but not sought (idiom)/one can only come across such things serendipitously
lit. like a tiger that has grown wings/with redoubled power (idiom)
